content.description:
The route climbs up a short step of ice into a deep cleft just off the road. Super classic for its grade.

Park at the 3 km sign there is usually a pull out that you can access on the river side of the road. From the parking spot Hike back approximate 100 m  up a short hill on the road and look uphill you will see two gully's that come two the road almost side by side, take the one to the left and hike up approximately 15 minutes.
Ice protection.

climbs.name: CRFSR-2.9 km The Great White Sheep

content.description:
Route climbs up multiple steps of WI2 and WI3 ice, finishing up high on Copper Mountain with some steep WI4 ice. Climbing higher in the gully you'll find multiple options for climbing other gully's that flow into the main gully. The route itself climbs the main gully. The lower pitches can be very snowy pending on the year.

Park at the 3 km sign there is usually a pull out that you can access on the river side of the road. From the parking spot Hike back approximate 100 m  up a short hill on the road and look uphill you will see two gully's that come two the road almost side by side, take the one to the North and hike up approximately 10 to 15 minutes to get to first pitch of grade 3 ice. I would say that this pitch is even worth it if you want a shorter day.
Ice protection.

Classic climbing right off the road. Look waterfall step of ice 15 feet off road that leads up into a cleft of rock (cool spot) with a one or two pitches of grade 2-3 ice.

Drive up Copper FSR and look for ice on the right hand side of the road at 3.6 km. The road is narrow here with the river on one side and rock on the right. Best parking can be found at 4km and walk back to route.  
Ice Protection

A number of routes were developed here to offer a longer season of ice. Many are bolted to climb in marginal conditions. The routes offer good movement with the pump your looking for when the warm weather and or rain is getting you down.

Drive up the Copper FSR to approximately 7.5 km and you can't miss it.
Ice screws and quick draws. Bolted anchors above.

Seepage off road.

Drive up FSR to km 9.
Ice Protection
Copper river FSR is located just East of Terrace BC and offers a few classic ice routes close to town for local residents.
